result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Kropelin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber and consecutive to any other sentence.  Court grants out of county travel and out of county service.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: of Conviction - orders payment every month or defendant to serve jail

11:47 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Holley Dornfeld present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding obligations due.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year and orders defendant to pay $100 by the end of July and every month thereafter and if not paid, defendant to spend 5 days in jail for each month not paid.  

Court adjourned at 11:50 a.m.
Order / Judgment Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations and for Restitution
Probation review hearing on May 28, 2019 at 11:30 am.

10:21 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Agent Holley Dornfeld present in court.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for 24 hours.  Defendant to contact the JA to schedule a hearing to come in within the next week.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.
and Stipulation to Waiver Appearance and Hearing
Probation review hearing on May 21, 2019 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (06/20/2019)

1:08 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kris Smoody present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding amount due.  Statement by Agent Smoody.  Further statement by defendant.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year or until paid in full.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: to defendant with sentencing paperwork to be signed and returned.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Dodge County Jail and without counsel.

10:10 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Dodge County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - still have an agreement and need to take care of matter in Dodge County first.  Court questions defendant re: video appearance or in-person.  Statement by defendant - is ok to proceed with plea & sentencing via video.  DA recites offer - upon plea to the charge, will recommend probation.  Defendant concurs, will accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guiltyon count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-30 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber.  Out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.
-Restitution - $510.00
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.
